_header: Saint Gregory a tale us tells
Bibliographic Ghosts: Cambridge UK, Cambridge University Library Dd.1.1, f. 202: ends just where this Narracio should begin.
_description: Gregory’s Aunts: a Narratio in the Northern Homily Cycle

BodEngPoeta1.First Lines:
Seint Gregori a tale vs tellesþer he on þis gospel
                    spelles…
BodEngPoeta1.Last Lines:
…Vre lord Ihesu crist vs spedeTo do penaunce and þider vs
                    lede. Amen.
BodEngPoeta1.Attributed Title:
De Tribus sororibus patris beati gregorij (f.
                    212ra)
BodEngPoeta1.Facsimiles:
Doyle,  I. A.,
                        ed.  
             The Vernon Manuscript. A Facsimile of Bodleian Library, Oxford, MS Eng.
                poet.a.1,
          with an introduction by A. I. Doyle. Cambridge: D. S. Brewer, 1987. 
Scase,  Wendy,  and  Nick Kennedy, eds.  
             A facsimile edition of the Vernon manuscript: Oxford, Bodleian Library, MS. Eng. Poet. A. 1.
         Oxford: The Bodleian Library, 2011.
BodEngPoeta1.Editions:
Horstmann,  Carl. 
             “Gregorius auf dem Steine. Aus Ms. Vernon p. 44.” 
             Archiv für das Studium der neueren Sprachen und
                Literaturen
            
                
                
            
         55 (1876): 407-38: 407-8.

CULGg531.First Lines:
Seyns gregor vs a tale tellesÞare he a pon þis gospell
                    spels…
CULGg531.Last Lines:
…Oure lorde ihesu cryst vs spedeTo do penance and þeder
                    vs lede
CULGg531.Note:
Begins 4 lines later in this MS, with ‘He sayd hys fader had
                    systerys thre…’.

HunHM129.First Lines:
Seint gregory a tale vs tellythÞare he a pon his gospell
                    spekkyth…
HunHM129.Last Lines:
…Oure loueryd ihesu crist vs spedeTo do penauns and
                    þyddyr vs lede
